abstract: Davy Jones - he was the short one in the Monkees, the cute one, the British one, and he and his mates sold millions of records in the 1960s. Mr. Jones, 66, died Wednesday in Florida, apparently of a heart attack. As Margalit Fox wrote in Mr. Jones' obituary in The Times, the Monkees "never pretended to be anything other than what it was: a smoke-and-mirrors incarnation'' of the Beatles that was "created for a benignly psychedelic American TV sitcom.''

headline.main: Davy Jones, Singer With the Monkees, Dies at 66
